person.persName: Rufus K. Williams (Judge of the Kentucky Court of Appeals)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, soldier, and judge. Married to Mahalia Williams. Father of Rufus Williams, Jr., Augusta Williams, Emma Williams, Kemble Williams, and Maggie Williams. Served as Circuit Court judge of the 1st Judicial District of Kentucky. Served as a delegate to the 1860 Democratic National Convention where he backed John C. Breckinridge. Served as a delegate to the 1861 Border State Convention. Served a judge of the Court of Appeals of Kentucky from 1862 to 1870, the last two years as chief justice.

bibl.p: H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 94; “An Eminent Jurist Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Kentucky), July 25, 1889; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 272.
